conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles under magnetic field to determine minimum velocity v1.
Negatively charged particles move in circular paths due to magnetic force.
Radius R of circular path is R = mv/qB.
Given charge-to-mass ratio q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg and magnetic field B = 5 x 10^-3 T.
Radius R is simplified to R = v/10^4.
Particles are emitted in all directions within the first quadrant.
Find minimum velocity v1 by considering particle emitted at angle theta intersecting x-axis at closest point.
Distance from source S to x-axis is d = 1.2 m.
Particle travels distance d along y-axis before reaching x-axis.
Using circle geometry, d = R sin(theta).
Find smallest theta such that particle intersects x-axis.
Substitute sin(48.5°) into equation: 1.2 = v/10^4 x 0.75.
Minimum velocity v1 required for particle to reach collection device is 16000 m/s.
